account_url.description: Represents your storage account in Azure. Typically of the format https://{account}.blob.core.windows.net.

compression.description: The compression method to be applied to the data before storing in Azure

container.description: A container organizes a set of blobs, similar to a directory in a file system.

partition_format.description: Specifies the format for organizing data into partitions within your Azure container. This determines the directory structure and naming convention for stored objects, affecting data organization and query efficiency. Examples include Hive-style partitioning (e.g., 'year=2024/month=01/day=01') and simple date-based formats (e.g., '2024/01/01').

prefix.description: An optional prefix for Azure object keys to organize data within the container

fleet_url.description: URL of the Fleet DM instance

use_synthetic_data.description: Generate synthetic demo data instead of connecting to the real data source.

actor_type.description: Type of actor. Ex: 'APT', 'eCrime', 'Hacktivist', 'Insider Threat', 'Nation-State', 'Unknown', 'Other', etc. Select 'None' for no preference.

cloud_type.description: Your cloud type for CrowdStrike. Ex: 'autodiscover', 'us-1', 'us-2', 'eu-1', 'us-gov-1'.

cron.description: Cron string for scheduling the ingest of your input

sort.description: Order fields in ascending or descending order. Ex: 'created_date|asc', 'created_date|desc'.

target_industries.description: Industries targeted by the actor. Ex: 'Financial', 'Healthcare', 'Energy', 'Government', 'Manufacturing', 'Technology', etc. Select 'None' for no preference.

use_synthetic_data.description: Generate synthetic demo data instead of connecting to the real data source.

value.description: The value to add to the record

email.description: Email address to use for authenticating with Google Cloud.

created_after.description: Only return audit log entries after this RFC3339 formatted time stamp

include.description: Event types to include. web: Gets all web (non-git) events. git: Gets git events. all: Gets both.

partition_format.description: Specifies the partition format of your S3 bucket. Select the option that matches how your data is currently organized in S3. This ensures that the system can correctly navigate your bucket structure. Options include Hive-compatible format ('year=2024/month=01/day=01') commonly used in data lake setups, and simple date format ('2024/01/01') for basic chronological organization.

prefix.description: Prefix of the S3 object keys to read.

record_location.description: Location of the record in the JSON object. This can be ignored if the record is not in JSON format.

role_arn.description: Role ARN to assume when reading from S3.

role_arn.description: The ARN of the IAM role to assume for accessing the SQS queue.

elasticsearch.AuthTypeEnum.description: The method of authentication to use with the Elasticsearch cluster. Choose between 'api_key' or 'password'.

elasticsearch.ConnectionTypeEnum.description: The type of connection to use with Elasticsearch. Choose between 'cloud_id' for Elastic Cloud or 'url' for direct connection.

cloud_id.description: The Cloud ID for connecting to an Elastic Cloud deployment. Required when connection_type is set to 'cloud_id'.

index.description: The name of the Elasticsearch index to write data to. If the index doesn't exist, it will be created automatically.

insecure_skip_verify.description: If set to true, it skips verification of the server's TLS certificate. This is insecure and should only be used for testing purposes.

url.description: The URL of the Elasticsearch cluster. Required when connection type is set to 'url'.

username.description: Username for authenticating with the Elasticsearch cluster.

category.description: The Category of logs to query

tenant_id.description: The tenant ID of the Azure AD application

workspace_id.description: The workspace ID of the Log Analytics workspace

app_name.description:
The application name monad uses to connect to the CrowdStrike data stream.
It's important that this name is unique to avoid conflicts with other applications
connecting to the same stream. You're advised to use a unique identifier for this
application. For example, if you have 2 stream input connections they should not both
be named 'monad'.

cloud.description: Your cloud type for CrowdStrike. Ex: 'autodiscover', 'us-1', 'us-2', 'eu-1', 'us-gov-1'.

member_cid.description:
In environments where an entity (like an MSSP) manages security for multiple clients,
each client is typically assigned a unique CID. This identifier allows the managing
entity to access and operate within the specific customer's environment. This is crucial
for scenarios where operational isolation between different clients' data and
configurations is necessary.

use_synthetic_data.description: Generate synthetic demo data instead of connecting to the real data source.

actor_sid.description: Only includes events initiated by this Actor. Useful for auditing actions taken by specific users or API credentials.

event_type.description: Only includes events of a specific event type: https://www.twilio.com/docs/usage/monitor-events#event-types

replication_start_time.description: Only include events after this time for the initial sync. If not specified, returns all events from the start. Must be a valid ISO 8601 formatted datetime string: yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z'

resource_sid.description: Only include events that refer to this resource. Useful for discovering the history of a specific resource.

compression.description: Compression format of the Google Cloud Storage objects.

format.description: The format of the files in the bucket, e.g., "json", "csv", etc.

partition_format.description: Specifies the partition format of your bucket. Select the option that matches how your data is currently organized. This ensures that the system can correctly navigate your bucket structure. Options include Hive-compatible format ('year=2024/month=01/day=01') commonly used in data lake setups, and simple date format ('2024/01/01') for basic chronological organization.

prefix.description: The prefix to use when reading from the bucket. This is used to filter objects in the bucket.

record_location.description: Location of the record in the JSON object. Applies only if the format is JSON.

bucket.description: The name of the bucket where data will be stored

compression.description: The compression method to be applied to the data before storing

partition_format.description: Specifies the format for organizing data into partitions within your bucket. This determines the directory structure and naming convention for stored objects, affecting data organization and query efficiency. Examples include Hive-style partitioning (e.g., 'year=2024/month=01/day=01') and simple date-based formats (e.g., '2024/01/01').

prefix.description: An optional prefix for object keys to organize data within the bucket

http.PayloadStructure.description: Determines how the payload is structured. 'single' sends each record as a separate request, 'array' sends multiple records as an array, 'wrapped' sends multiple records within a wrapper object.

endpoint.description: The full URL of the HTTP endpoint to send data to. Must include the scheme (http or https).

max_batch_data_size.description: The maximum size in KB for a single batch of data to be sent in one request. This does not effect the single payload structure.

max_batch_record_count.description: The maximum number of records to include in a single batch. For single payload structure, this is automatically set to 1. For other payload structures, this determines the maximum number of records sent in a single request.

method.description: The HTTP method to use for requests (GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, or DELETE).

rate_limit.description: Maximum number of requests per second to send to the endpoint.

wrapper_key.description: The key to use for wrapping the payload when PayloadStructure is set to 'wrapped'.

analyzer_arn.description: The [ARN of the analyzer] to retrieve findings from.

cron.description: Cron string for scheduling the ingest of your input. eg: `0 0 * * *` - Daily at midnight, or `*/15 * * * *` - Every 15 minutes

filters.description: A filter to match for the findings to return.

region.description: The Region that you would receieve findings for

role_arn.description: The ARN of the role to assume to access the bucket

embed.description: Embed related resources in the data returned (e.g., read-consolidated-alert)

primary_entity_value.description: Filter by primary entity value (contains search)

bucket.description: The name of the object storage bucket where data will be stored

compression.description: The compression method to be applied to the data before storing

endpoint.description: The endpoint URL for the object storage service (e.g., https://fly.storage.tigris.dev, https://minio.example.com)

partition_format.description: Specifies the format for organizing data into partitions within your bucket. This determines the directory structure and naming convention for stored objects, affecting data organization and query efficiency. Examples include Hive-style partitioning (e.g., 'year=2024/month=01/day=01') and simple date-based formats (e.g., '2024/01/01').

prefix.description: An optional prefix for object keys to organize data within the bucket

region.description: The region for the object storage service (optional for some providers)

skip_ssl_verification.description: Whether to skip SSL certificate verification (useful for self-signed certificates or development environments)

use_path_style.description: Whether to use path-style URLs (bucket.endpoint.com/object vs endpoint.com/bucket/object). Most S3-compatible services require this to be true.

endpoint.description: Endpoint URL for the object storage service (e.g., https://minio.example.com, https://s3.amazonaws.com)

partition_format.description: Specifies the partition format of your bucket. Select the option that matches how your data is currently organized. This ensures that the system can correctly navigate your bucket structure. Options include Hive-compatible format ('year=2024/month=01/day=01') commonly used in data lake setups, and simple date format ('2024/01/01') for basic chronological organization.

prefix.description: Prefix that leads to the start of the expected partition. For example: "/foobar/year=2024/month=01/day=01/". The prefix is `foobar`.

record_location.description: Location of the record in the JSON object. This can be ignored if the record is not in JSON format. If the records are not nested in the JSON, you can use '@this' to indicate that the file contains the record at the root or an array of records.

region.description: Optional region for the object storage service. This is often required for services like AWS S3.

skip_ssl_verification.description: Skip SSL verification for self-signed certificates

use_path_style.description: Whether to use path-style URLs (bucket.endpoint.com/object vs endpoint.com/bucket/object). Most S3-compatible services require this to be true.

subdomain.description: SubDomain is a placeholder that represents your specific OneLogin subdomain.

pagerduty.alertsConfig.description: AlertsConfig contains configuration options that apply only when EventType is set to 'alert'

class.description: Class defines the class/type of the event based on the input source. Defaults to an empty value.

group.description: A cluster or grouping of sources. For example, sources \"prod-datapipe-02\" and \"prod-datapipe-03\" might both be part of \"prod-datapipe\". Applicable if event type is set to alerts. Defaults to an empty value.

severity.description: Indicates the severity of the impact to the affected system. Applicable for you if event type is set to alerts. Defaults to 'critical'.

pagerduty.eventType.description:
EventType determines whether events are sent as 'change' or 'alert' events.
We recommend reading the docs for this output before making this choice.

pagerduty.summaryConfig.description: SummaryConfig allows customization of event summary messages displayed in PagerDuty

alert_source.description: alertSource is the source identifier for alert events. Defaults to 'monad-platform'.

alert_summary.description: alertSummary is the custom summary message for alert events. Defaults to 'Monad triggered alert event'.

change_source.description: changeSource is the source identifier for change events. Defaults to 'monad-platform'.

change_summary.description: changeSummary is the custom summary message for change events. Defaults to 'Monad triggered change event'.

saml.description: SAML is the configuration for SAML connections

bucket.description: The name of the S3 bucket where data will be stored

compression.description: The compression method to be applied to the data before storing in S3

partition_format.description: Specifies the format for organizing data into partitions within your S3 bucket. This determines the directory structure and naming convention for stored objects, affecting data organization and query efficiency. Examples include Hive-style partitioning (e.g., 'year=2024/month=01/day=01') and simple date-based formats (e.g., '2024/01/01').

prefix.description: An optional prefix for S3 object keys to organize data within the bucket

region.description: The AWS region where the S3 bucket is located

role_arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to assume which grants access to the S3 bucket

cron.description: Cron expression for scheduling the input

include_planned_deletion.description: Whether or not to include secrets scheduled for deletion

role_arn.description: The ID of the secret to describe

allow_insecure.description: Whether to allow insecure connections (not recommended for production).

index.description: The index you want to send data to. If left empty, data is sent to the default index associated with the token. If specified, please read our docs for more context on Splunk token & Index scoping.

port.description: The port of the Splunk instance.

to_create.description: Ensure this is selected if you want Monad to create the index for you. If you are using a pre-existing index, please leave this deselected. Read our docs for more context on Splunk token & Index scoping.

url.description: The URL of the Splunk instance (must start with http or https).

username.description: Represents an administrative account to manage indices. Used to create an index, hence can be left empty if default index is to be used.

types.ChildType.description: Specifies whether to list AWS accounts or organizational units (OUs) as children of the parent entity.

types.FilterNameStringType.description:
The following are keys you can use:

  - description: Prefix match, not case-sensitive.

  - name: Prefix match, case-sensitive.

  - tag-key: Prefix match, case-sensitive.

  - tag-value: Prefix match, case-sensitive.

  - primary-region: Prefix match, case-sensitive.

  - owning-service: Prefix match, case-sensitive.

  - all: Breaks the filter value string into words and then searches all
  attributes for matches. Not case-sensitive.
